intro: Biscutella chilensis, commonly known as Chilean biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are basal, often lobed, and its stems are usually hairy. Biscutella chilensis is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in South American herbal medicine.
